parameters: \pop[2]I enter the hotel room with Taylor, ready to chat with him some more.
\pop[2]Last time we talked, he opened up a lot. I'm not sure what was left.
\pop[2]I know about his vision, his past, and what makes him tick.
\pop[2]Maybe I could just strike this one off the list.
\pop[2]Taylor has made his intentions and personality clear from day one.
\pop[2]A moment to let my guard down and relax with a friend? Can't pass \c[14]that\c[0] up.
\pop[3]You know, we've got a great view from up here.
Pretty high up, but not high enough that the people become a blur.
\pop[2]He stares out the window, at the cityscape of Toronto.
\pop[3]You know, I still remember the day I flew here.
In fact, I remember every flight I've ever been on.
\pop[2]The way he says this, implies that he flew around a lot.
\pop[2]Due to his past, I'm pretty certain that the implication is accurate.
\pop[3]I thought it'd only be a matter of time before they transferred me somewhere else.
But you know what? They didn't. They basically just threw me away.
\pop[3]I guess when we reach a certain age, they think you can "fend for yourself".
It's odd. Like, one day, we wake up, with all that added responsibility.
The two worst things to go hand-in-hand.
\pop[3]A lot of people just crash and burn in a situation like that.
I think the mark of success is someone who perseveres.
\pop[3]And persevering means not giving up when things get tough.
Or scary. We've been experiencing a lot of \c[14]that\c[0] lately.
\pop[2]Is he having doubts about all of this?
\pop[2]I can't really blame him, but I hate to hear it.
\pop[3]If I didn't already have a following?
Well, Toronto would've eaten me alive.
\pop[3]I only got off the ground because they were willing to help me.
But after everything I went through, I think I deserved it.
\pop[2]I remember the story about how his allergy was exploited.
\pop[2]It's truly terrible that somebody would resort to something like that.
\pop[2]But what strikes me as more profound, is how it affected Taylor.
\pop[2]Someone could come out of that situation bitter, and hating the world.
\pop[2]Yet here he was, a man who changed for the better.
\pop[2]So much so, in fact, that he was certain he had beaten his vision.
\pop[2]Of course, he was super flirtatious, and his partners seemed numerous.
\pop[2]A key trait of someone looking to make up for lost time.
\pop[2]A time lost to pushing everybody away...
\pop[2]I stand beside him, and we look out the window together.
\pop[2]The sight was pretty familiar by now, with how much I've been up here.
\pop[2]But one by one, I've seen my friends take in the sight, and enjoy the beauty.
\pop[3]I'd hate to lose what I have.
Even if it \c[14]was\c[0] in the pursuit of something good.
I'm still thankful that Isaac gave us the option to run.
\pop[2]He places his hand on the window, leaving a print.
\pop[2]It adds to the ones already present, like a mosaic of our stay.
\pop[3]That's why I was thinking about my flights again, by the way.
As I flew from place to place, I got to leave my baggage behind.
Of course, I just created \c[14]new\c[0] baggage, but I can only blame myself for that.
\pop[3]As the plane was taking off, I'd stare out the window.
In fact, I'd keep my eyes glued to it the entire time.
But take-off and landing were always my favorite.
\pop[3]I looked down on the people as we rose up.
All of them, together, writing the city's story.
A story that I'd no longer be a part of.
\pop[3]And that hurt me for a while.
But as we rose up, they got smaller and smaller.
I lost their faces, their outfits, and then... everything.
\pop[3]You know what? It stopped hurting. It felt \c[14]good\c[0].
I'd never have to see anybody that wronged me again.
And at the same time, I couldn't hurt anyone else who lived there, either.
\pop[3]That might've been what made me a bully, to be honest.
No matter how much chaos I caused, they'd just move me again.
I'd escape all consequences of my actions. I'd have nothing to face.
\pop[3]I remember when we started our descent into Toronto.
At that point, I had already started to change.
\pop[3]Normally, I'd look at a new city as a place to run amok.
But because of my hospital stay, I saw things a bit differently.
I noticed the people as we landed, going about their days.
\pop[3]A city that had a story \c[14]wholly\c[0] unaffected by me.
Yet one that was waiting for me to make my mark.
\pop[3]I told myself that I wouldn't make the same mistakes.
And now, before you, stands the \c[14]best\c[0] version of me.
\pop[2]He turns to face me, and I can see the sadness in his eyes.
\pop[3]I'm just scared that things won't stay this way.
I turned my life around - became happiness for so many people.
What if we get caught? What if we get thrown in jail?
\pop[3]What about everyone that looks up to me?
What about all the friends that I have in my industry?
\pop[3]How can I do something so reckless?
Why am I so torn between my image, and my beliefs?
\i[3]"It's normal to feel the things you're feeling."
\i[3]"It's normal to feel the things you're feeling."
\i[3]"A little hesitation is normal when you're changing the world."
\i[3]"A little hesitation is normal when you're changing the world."
\i[3]"You'll be heralded as a hero for this. Not punished."
\i[3]"You'll be heralded as a hero for this. Not punished."
\i[3]"I know so. \c[10]Argus\c[0] can't keep the world in their grip."
\i[3]"I know so. \c[10]Argus\c[0] can't keep the world in their grip."
\pop[3]What if they catch us? They can just lock us up.
That, and write any narrative they want. Make us look \c[14]bad\c[0].
\i[3]"No. Our story will definitely be told."
\i[3]"No. Our story will definitely be told."
\pop[2]I let him know that it's not like that.
\pop[2]In fact, I see no reason to hide my theory about the future from him.
\i[3]"Well, \c[10]Argus\c[0] is working on some new tech..."
\i[3]"Well, \c[10]Argus\c[0] is working on some new tech..."
It was on their anniversary report, and a follow-up keynote.
Can you believe that? They \c[14]totally\c[0] ignored the \c[23]zeros\c[0].
\pop[3]Instead, they just flaunted everything they could.
It's like Dante always says, they only care about their ego.
But now? Lives are on the line. They have \c[10]blood\c[0] on their hands.
\i[3]"Yeah. They could be watching us right now to see if we're good people."
\i[3]"Yeah. They could be watching us right now to see if we're good people."
Especially if this tech comes out in our lifetime.
I wonder what things have been like from Isaac's perspective.
\pop[2]It's an interesting thought, to say the least.
\pop[2]Running \c[23]Cipher\c[0] while dealing with all of us...?
\pop[2]Anyone else might've caved under the pressure.
\pop[3]I'm used to being watched and judged from the future, anyway.
\pop[3]Well, whenever I end a stream, a re-run is uploaded.
People can watch it over and over again, whenever they want.
That past version of me is constantly being observed. Even now.
\pop[3]It's like a time capsule of that \c[14]exact\c[0] point in my life.
Relative to me, if you watch it \c[14]now\c[0], you're watching from the future.
This new tech seems just like that, with a few more layers of depth.
\pop[2]It's funny how him and Isaac share the same train of thought as me.
\pop[2]This would just the next generation way of preserving memories.
\pop[2]It's not enough to hear them, or see them. We'll be able to \c[14]live\c[0] them, too.
\pop[2]It was obviously an excuse to spy on us even more, which is truly awful.
\pop[2]But I know we can turn this around, and use it to our advantage.
\pop[2]Well, it might not even matter if we fail our mission on Sunday.
\pop[2]If they ever made that technology, we could use it to show people our memories.
\pop[2]And that would supersede \c[14]anything\c[0] \c[10]Argus\c[0] said about us.
\pop[2]Sure, they \c[14]could\c[0] use this technology to invade our privacy even more...
\pop[2]But as a double-edged sword, it would let stifled voices be heard.
\pop[3]Reminds me of that talk we had after The Wayfarer.
You know, how when people die, they return to the stars?
\pop[3]I made a dumb joke about my ancestors watching me make out.
Pretty ironic that it's gonna be my \c[14]descendants\c[0] who have that chance.
Almost everything has ended up being the opposite of what I thought.
\i[3]"And you thought we might lose, right...?"
\i[3]"And you thought we might lose, right...?"
But challenging my thoughts can only help in the end.
So I'm gonna try and turn this doubt into resolve.
\pop[3]I still plan on sticking to our pact, you know.
Whether I believe it's possible or not? It doesn't matter.
What matters are the steps I take. Here, and now.
\pop[3]And I'm glad to have you by my side, Delta.
Whatever happens, at least I'm not alone in all this.
At least we'd be going down \c[14]together\c[0].
So no matter what, I know I've beaten my vision.
\pop[3]Besides, the darkness feels less scary when you're around...
\pop[2]I hold out my hand, and he places his in mine.
\pop[2]We stand there, staring out the window in silence.
\pop[2]Perhaps it was because we didn't need words anymore.
\pop[2]I can feel everything he wants to say through the grip on my hand.
\pop[2]Part of me wonders if he can feel the same in mine.
\pop[2]Without a word, he smiles at me, and blushes.
\pop[2]I smile back, and then our attention is diverted back to the window.
\pop[2]He holds out his fist, and I bump mine against it.
\pop[2]It's good to know that he enjoys my company.
\pop[2]We give each other a brief smile before our gaze goes back to the window.
\pop[2]A city whose story was on the verge of a new page.
\pop[2]And with any luck, it'd be a page written by the people. Not \c[10]Argus\c[0].
